required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Allopurinol Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR4640 in Subjects With Gout
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Allopurinol Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR4640 in Subjects With Gout

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the serum uric acid lowering effects and safety of SHR4640 compared to Allopurinol in subjects with gout.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of SHR4640 monotherapy tablets in patients with gout

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with a serum uric acid level≤360 μmol/L
primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment to end of study (approximately 16 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change in serum uric acid from baseline at each visit during 16 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment to end of study (approximately 16 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute changes in serum uric acid from baseline at each visit during 16 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment to end of study (approximately 16 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with A serum uric acid level≤ 360 μmol/L at each visit within 16 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment to end of study (approximately 16 weeks)

arm_group.description: SHR4640+Allopurinol Placebo；once a day, orally, for 16 weeks
Allopurinol+ SHR4640 Placebo；once a day, orally, for 16 weeks.

facility.name: RenJi Hospital, Shanghai JiaoTong University School Of Medicine
